title: Overview of the wcde package
text: can install released version wcde CRAN : Install developmental version :
code: install.packages("wcde") library(devtools) install_github("guyabel/wcde", ref = "main")

title: Overview of the wcde package
text: get_wcde() function can used download data Wittgenstein Centre Human Capital Data Explorer. requires three user inputs indicator: short code indicator interest scenario: number referring SSP narrative, default 2 used (SSP2) country_code (country_name): corresponding country interest
code: library(wcde) # download education specific tfr data get_wcde(indicator = "etfr",          country_name = c("Brazil", "Albania")) #> # A tibble: 204 × 6 #>    scenario name    country_code education          period     etfr #>       <dbl> <chr>          <dbl> <chr>              <chr>     <dbl> #>  1        2 Brazil            76 No Education       2015-2020  2.47 #>  2        2 Albania            8 No Education       2015-2020  1.88 #>  3        2 Brazil            76 Incomplete Primary 2015-2020  2.47 #>  4        2 Albania            8 Incomplete Primary 2015-2020  1.88 #>  5        2 Brazil            76 Primary            2015-2020  2.47 #>  6        2 Albania            8 Primary            2015-2020  1.88 #>  7        2 Brazil            76 Lower Secondary    2015-2020  1.89 #>  8        2 Albania            8 Lower Secondary    2015-2020  1.9  #>  9        2 Brazil            76 Upper Secondary    2015-2020  1.37 #> 10        2 Albania            8 Upper Secondary    2015-2020  1.57 #> # … with 194 more rows  # download education specific survivorship rates get_wcde(indicator = "eassr",          country_name = c("Niger", "Korea")) #> # A tibble: 8,976 × 8 #>    scenario name              country_code age     sex   education  period eassr #>       <dbl> <chr>                    <dbl> <chr>   <chr> <chr>      <chr>  <dbl> #>  1        2 Niger                      562 Newborn Male  No Educat… 2015-…  91.6 #>  2        2 Republic of Korea          410 Newborn Male  No Educat… 2015-…  99.4 #>  3        2 Niger                      562 Newborn Male  Incomplet… 2015-…  92   #>  4        2 Republic of Korea          410 Newborn Male  Incomplet… 2015-…  99.5 #>  5        2 Niger                      562 Newborn Male  Primary    2015-…  92.5 #>  6        2 Republic of Korea          410 Newborn Male  Primary    2015-…  99.5 #>  7        2 Niger                      562 Newborn Male  Lower Sec… 2015-…  93.4 #>  8        2 Republic of Korea          410 Newborn Male  Lower Sec… 2015-…  99.6 #>  9        2 Niger                      562 Newborn Male  Upper Sec… 2015-…  95.2 #> 10        2 Republic of Korea          410 Newborn Male  Upper Sec… 2015-…  99.7 #> # … with 8,966 more rows

title: Overview of the wcde package
text: indicator input must match short code indicator table. find_indicator() function can used look short codes (given first column) wic_indicators data frame:
code: find_indicator(x = "tfr") #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   indicator description                       definition                         #>   <chr>     <chr>                             <chr>                              #> 1 tfr       Total Fertility Rate              "The average number of children b… #> 2 etfr      Total Fertility Rate by Education "The average number of children b…

title: Overview of the wcde package
text: default, get_wdce() returns data years available periods years. filter() function dplyr can used filter data specific years periods, example: Past data available selected indicators. can viewed using past indicator column: filter() function can also used filter specific indicators specific age, sex education groups
code: library(tidyverse) get_wcde(indicator = "e0",          country_name = c("Japan", "Australia")) %>%   filter(period == "2015-2020") #> # A tibble: 4 × 6 #>   scenario name      country_code sex    period       e0 #>      <dbl> <chr>            <dbl> <chr>  <chr>     <dbl> #> 1        2 Japan              392 Male   2015-2020  80.7 #> 2        2 Australia           36 Male   2015-2020  81.3 #> 3        2 Japan              392 Female 2015-2020  87.2 #> 4        2 Australia           36 Female 2015-2020  85  get_wcde(indicator = "sexratio",          country_name = c("China", "South Korea")) %>%   filter(year == 2020) #> # A tibble: 44 × 6 #>    scenario name              country_code age     year sexratio #>       <dbl> <chr>                    <dbl> <chr>  <int>    <dbl> #>  1        2 China                      156 All     2020     1.06 #>  2        2 Republic of Korea          410 All     2020     1    #>  3        2 China                      156 0--4    2020     1.15 #>  4        2 Republic of Korea          410 0--4    2020     1.07 #>  5        2 China                      156 5--9    2020     1.16 #>  6        2 Republic of Korea          410 5--9    2020     1.07 #>  7        2 China                      156 10--14  2020     1.17 #>  8        2 Republic of Korea          410 10--14  2020     1.07 #>  9        2 China                      156 15--19  2020     1.16 #> 10        2 Republic of Korea          410 15--19  2020     1.1  #> # … with 34 more rows wic_indicators %>%   filter(past) %>%   select(1:2) #> # A tibble: 28 × 2 #>    indicator description                                      #>    <chr>     <chr>                                            #>  1 pop       Population Size (000's)                          #>  2 bpop      Population Size by Broad Age (000's)             #>  3 epop      Population Size by Education (000's)             #>  4 prop      Educational Attainment Distribution              #>  5 bprop     Educational Attainment Distribution by Broad Age #>  6 growth    Average Annual Growth Rate                       #>  7 nirate    Average Annual Rate of Natural Increase          #>  8 sexratio  Sex Ratio                                        #>  9 mage      Population Median Age                            #> 10 tdr       Total Dependency Ratio                           #> # … with 18 more rows get_wcde(indicator = "sexratio",          country_name = c("China", "South Korea")) %>%   filter(year == 2020,          age == "All") #> # A tibble: 2 × 6 #>   scenario name              country_code age    year sexratio #>      <dbl> <chr>                    <dbl> <chr> <int>    <dbl> #> 1        2 China                      156 All    2020     1.06 #> 2        2 Republic of Korea          410 All    2020     1

title: Overview of the wcde package
text: Country names guessed using countrycode package. get_wcde() functions accepts ISO alpha numeric codes countries via country_code argument: full list available countries region aggregates, codes, can found wic_locations data frame.
code: get_wcde(indicator = "tfr",          country_name = c("U.A.E", "Espania", "Österreich")) #> # A tibble: 90 × 5 #>    scenario name                 country_code period      tfr #>       <dbl> <chr>                       <dbl> <chr>     <dbl> #>  1        2 United Arab Emirates          784 1950-1955  6.97 #>  2        2 Spain                         724 1950-1955  2.53 #>  3        2 Austria                        40 1950-1955  2.1  #>  4        2 United Arab Emirates          784 1955-1960  6.97 #>  5        2 Spain                         724 1955-1960  2.7  #>  6        2 Austria                        40 1955-1960  2.57 #>  7        2 United Arab Emirates          784 1960-1965  6.87 #>  8        2 Spain                         724 1960-1965  2.81 #>  9        2 Austria                        40 1960-1965  2.78 #> 10        2 United Arab Emirates          784 1965-1970  6.77 #> # … with 80 more rows get_wcde(indicator = "etfr", country_code = c(44, 100)) #> # A tibble: 204 × 6 #>    scenario name     country_code education          period     etfr #>       <dbl> <chr>           <dbl> <chr>              <chr>     <dbl> #>  1        2 Bahamas            44 No Education       2015-2020  2.71 #>  2        2 Bulgaria          100 No Education       2015-2020  1.72 #>  3        2 Bahamas            44 Incomplete Primary 2015-2020  2.71 #>  4        2 Bulgaria          100 Incomplete Primary 2015-2020  1.72 #>  5        2 Bahamas            44 Primary            2015-2020  2.71 #>  6        2 Bulgaria          100 Primary            2015-2020  1.72 #>  7        2 Bahamas            44 Lower Secondary    2015-2020  2.09 #>  8        2 Bulgaria          100 Lower Secondary    2015-2020  1.73 #>  9        2 Bahamas            44 Upper Secondary    2015-2020  1.76 #> 10        2 Bulgaria          100 Upper Secondary    2015-2020  1.44 #> # … with 194 more rows wic_locations #> # A tibble: 230 × 5 #>    name                            isono continent region             dim     #>    <chr>                           <dbl> <chr>     <chr>              <chr>   #>  1 World                             900 NA        NA                 area    #>  2 Africa                            903 NA        NA                 area    #>  3 Asia                              935 NA        NA                 area    #>  4 Europe                            908 NA        NA                 area    #>  5 Latin America and the Caribbean   904 NA        NA                 area    #>  6 Northern America                  905 NA        NA                 area    #>  7 Oceania                           909 NA        NA                 area    #>  8 Afghanistan                         4 Asia      South-Central Asia country #>  9 Albania                             8 Europe    Southern Europe    country #> 10 Algeria                            12 Africa    Northern Africa    country #> # … with 220 more rows

title: Overview of the wcde package
text: default get_wcde() returns data Medium (SSP2) scenario. Results different SSP scenarios can returned passing different (multiple) scenario values scenario argument get_data(). Set include_scenario_names = TRUE include columns full names scenarios Additional details pathways scenario numeric code can found wic_scenarios object. background links corresponding literature provided Data Explorer
code: get_wcde(indicator = "growth",          country_name = c("India", "China"),          scenario = c(1:3, 21, 22)) %>%   filter(period == "2095-2100") #> # A tibble: 10 × 5 #>    scenario name  country_code period    growth #>       <dbl> <chr>        <dbl> <chr>      <dbl> #>  1        1 India          356 2095-2100   -0.7 #>  2        1 China          156 2095-2100   -1.1 #>  3        2 India          356 2095-2100   -0.5 #>  4        2 China          156 2095-2100   -1   #>  5        3 India          356 2095-2100    0.2 #>  6        3 China          156 2095-2100   -0.2 #>  7       21 India          356 2095-2100   -0.5 #>  8       21 China          156 2095-2100   -0.9 #>  9       22 India          356 2095-2100   -0.5 #> 10       22 China          156 2095-2100   -1 get_wcde(indicator = "tfr",          country_name = c("Kenya", "Nigeria", "Algeria"),          scenario = 1:3,          include_scenario_names = TRUE) %>%   filter(period == "2045-2050") #> # A tibble: 9 × 7 #>   scenario scenario_name              scenario_abb name    countr…¹ period   tfr #>      <dbl> <chr>                      <chr>        <chr>      <dbl> <chr>  <dbl> #> 1        1 Rapid Development (SSP1)   SSP1         Kenya        404 2045-…  1.62 #> 2        1 Rapid Development (SSP1)   SSP1         Nigeria      566 2045-…  2.29 #> 3        1 Rapid Development (SSP1)   SSP1         Algeria       12 2045-…  1.53 #> 4        2 Medium (SSP2)              SSP2         Kenya        404 2045-…  2.36 #> 5        2 Medium (SSP2)              SSP2         Nigeria      566 2045-…  3.37 #> 6        2 Medium (SSP2)              SSP2         Algeria       12 2045-…  1.77 #> 7        3 Stalled Development (SSP3) SSP3         Kenya        404 2045-…  3.33 #> 8        3 Stalled Development (SSP3) SSP3         Nigeria      566 2045-…  4.65 #> 9        3 Stalled Development (SSP3) SSP3         Algeria       12 2045-…  2.41 #> # … with abbreviated variable name ¹​country_code wic_scenarios #> # A tibble: 5 × 3 #>   scenario_name                         scenario scenario_abb #>   <chr>                                    <dbl> <chr>        #> 1 Rapid Development (SSP1)                     1 SSP1         #> 2 Medium (SSP2)                                2 SSP2         #> 3 Stalled Development (SSP3)                   3 SSP3         #> 4 Medium - Zero Migration (SSP2 - ZM)         21 SSP2ZM       #> 5 Medium - Double Migration (SSP2 - DM)       22 SSP2DM

title: Overview of the wcde package
text: Data countries can obtained setting country_name country_code
code: get_wcde(indicator = "mage") #> # A tibble: 7,099 × 5 #>    scenario name                     country_code  year  mage #>       <dbl> <chr>                           <dbl> <int> <dbl> #>  1        2 Bulgaria                          100  1950  27.3 #>  2        2 Myanmar                           104  1950  22.8 #>  3        2 Burundi                           108  1950  19.5 #>  4        2 Belarus                           112  1950  27.2 #>  5        2 Cambodia                          116  1950  18.7 #>  6        2 Algeria                            12  1950  19.4 #>  7        2 Cameroon                          120  1950  20.8 #>  8        2 Canada                            124  1950  27.7 #>  9        2 Cape Verde                        132  1950  23   #> 10        2 Central African Republic          140  1950  22.5 #> # … with 7,089 more rows

title: Overview of the wcde package
text: get_wdce() function needs called multiple times download multiple indicators. can done using map() function purrr
code: mi <- tibble(ind = c("odr", "nirate", "ggapedu25")) %>%   mutate(d = map(.x = ind, .f = ~get_wcde(indicator = .x))) mi #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   ind       d                     #>   <chr>     <list>                #> 1 odr       <tibble [7,099 × 5]>  #> 2 nirate    <tibble [6,870 × 5]>  #> 3 ggapedu25 <tibble [41,346 × 6]>  mi %>%   filter(ind == "odr") %>%   select(-ind) %>%   unnest(cols = d) #> # A tibble: 7,099 × 5 #>    scenario name                     country_code  year   odr #>       <dbl> <chr>                           <dbl> <int> <dbl> #>  1        2 Bulgaria                          100  1950  0.1  #>  2        2 Myanmar                           104  1950  0.05 #>  3        2 Burundi                           108  1950  0.06 #>  4        2 Belarus                           112  1950  0.13 #>  5        2 Cambodia                          116  1950  0.05 #>  6        2 Algeria                            12  1950  0.06 #>  7        2 Cameroon                          120  1950  0.06 #>  8        2 Canada                            124  1950  0.12 #>  9        2 Cape Verde                        132  1950  0.13 #> 10        2 Central African Republic          140  1950  0.09 #> # … with 7,089 more rows  mi %>%   filter(ind == "nirate") %>%   select(-ind) %>%   unnest(cols = d) #> # A tibble: 6,870 × 5 #>    scenario name                     country_code period    nirate #>       <dbl> <chr>                           <dbl> <chr>      <dbl> #>  1        2 Bulgaria                          100 1950-1955   11.1 #>  2        2 Myanmar                           104 1950-1955   19.1 #>  3        2 Burundi                           108 1950-1955   24.1 #>  4        2 Belarus                           112 1950-1955   10.1 #>  5        2 Cambodia                          116 1950-1955   25.9 #>  6        2 Algeria                            12 1950-1955   27.1 #>  7        2 Cameroon                          120 1950-1955   17.6 #>  8        2 Canada                            124 1950-1955   18.9 #>  9        2 Cape Verde                        132 1950-1955   26.9 #> 10        2 Central African Republic          140 1950-1955   10.7 #> # … with 6,860 more rows  mi %>%   filter(ind == "ggapedu25") %>%   select(-ind) %>%   unnest(cols = d) #> # A tibble: 41,346 × 6 #>    scenario name                     country_code  year education    ggapedu25 #>       <dbl> <chr>                           <dbl> <int> <chr>            <int> #>  1        2 Bulgaria                          100  1950 No Education       -20 #>  2        2 Myanmar                           104  1950 No Education       -13 #>  3        2 Burundi                           108  1950 No Education        -6 #>  4        2 Belarus                           112  1950 No Education       -10 #>  5        2 Cambodia                          116  1950 No Education       -21 #>  6        2 Algeria                            12  1950 No Education        -2 #>  7        2 Cameroon                          120  1950 No Education       -13 #>  8        2 Canada                            124  1950 No Education        -2 #>  9        2 Cape Verde                        132  1950 No Education        -9 #> 10        2 Central African Republic          140  1950 No Education        -1 #> # … with 41,336 more rows

title: Overview of the wcde package
text: Population data range age-sex-educational attainment combinations can obtained setting indicator = "pop" get_wcde() specifying pop_age, pop_sex pop_edu arguments. default three population breakdown arguments set “total” pop_age argument can set get population data broken five-year age groups. pop_sex argument can set get population data broken female male groups. pop_edu argument can set four, six eight get population data broken education categorizations different levels detail. population breakdown arguments can used combination provide breakdowns, example sex education specific population totals full age-sex-education specific data can also obtained setting indicator = "epop" get_wcde().
code: get_wcde(indicator = "pop", country_name = "India") #> Version wcde-v3 not available on server, using wcde-v2 #> # A tibble: 31 × 5 #>    scenario name  country_code  year     pop #>       <dbl> <chr>        <dbl> <int>   <dbl> #>  1        2 India          356  1950 376325. #>  2        2 India          356  1955 409276. #>  3        2 India          356  1960 449604. #>  4        2 India          356  1965 497830. #>  5        2 India          356  1970 553787. #>  6        2 India          356  1975 621525. #>  7        2 India          356  1980 697040. #>  8        2 India          356  1985 781904. #>  9        2 India          356  1990 870422. #> 10        2 India          356  1995 960733. #> # … with 21 more rows get_wcde(indicator = "pop", country_code = 900, pop_edu = "four") #> Version wcde-v3 not available on server, using wcde-v2 #> # A tibble: 155 × 6 #>    scenario name  country_code  year education          pop #>       <dbl> <fct>        <dbl> <int> <fct>            <dbl> #>  1        2 World          900  1950 Under 15       868844. #>  2        2 World          900  1950 No Education   763612. #>  3        2 World          900  1950 Primary        549510. #>  4        2 World          900  1950 Secondary      329182. #>  5        2 World          900  1950 Post Secondary  30143. #>  6        2 World          900  1955 Under 15       984764. #>  7        2 World          900  1955 No Education   762022. #>  8        2 World          900  1955 Primary        600299. #>  9        2 World          900  1955 Secondary      392261. #> 10        2 World          900  1955 Post Secondary  38199. #> # … with 145 more rows get_wcde(indicator = "pop", country_code = 900, pop_edu = "six", pop_sex = "both") #> Version wcde-v3 not available on server, using wcde-v2 #> # A tibble: 434 × 7 #>    scenario name  country_code  year sex    education              pop #>       <dbl> <fct>        <dbl> <int> <fct>  <fct>                <dbl> #>  1        2 World          900  1950 Male   Under 15           443968. #>  2        2 World          900  1950 Male   No Education       317636. #>  3        2 World          900  1950 Male   Incomplete Primary 116692. #>  4        2 World          900  1950 Male   Primary            194902  #>  5        2 World          900  1950 Male   Lower Secondary    104160  #>  6        2 World          900  1950 Male   Upper Secondary     69384. #>  7        2 World          900  1950 Male   Post Secondary      21102. #>  8        2 World          900  1950 Female Under 15           424877. #>  9        2 World          900  1950 Female No Education       445976. #> 10        2 World          900  1950 Female Incomplete Primary  81231. #> # … with 424 more rows

title: Overview of the wcde package
text: Create population pyramids setting male population values negative equivalent allow divergent columns y axis.
code: w <- get_wcde(indicator = "pop", country_code = 900,               pop_age = "all", pop_sex = "both", pop_edu = "four") #> Version wcde-v3 not available on server, using wcde-v2 w #> # A tibble: 6,510 × 8 #>    scenario name  country_code  year age   sex    education          pop #>       <dbl> <fct>        <dbl> <int> <fct> <fct>  <fct>            <dbl> #>  1        2 World          900  1950 0--4  Male   Under 15       172362. #>  2        2 World          900  1950 0--4  Male   No Education        0  #>  3        2 World          900  1950 0--4  Male   Primary             0  #>  4        2 World          900  1950 0--4  Male   Secondary           0  #>  5        2 World          900  1950 0--4  Male   Post Secondary      0  #>  6        2 World          900  1950 0--4  Female Under 15       166026. #>  7        2 World          900  1950 0--4  Female No Education        0  #>  8        2 World          900  1950 0--4  Female Primary             0  #>  9        2 World          900  1950 0--4  Female Secondary           0  #> 10        2 World          900  1950 0--4  Female Post Secondary      0  #> # … with 6,500 more rows  w <- w %>%   mutate(pop_pm = ifelse(test = sex == "Male", yes = -pop, no = pop),          pop_pm = pop_pm/1e3) w #> # A tibble: 6,510 × 9 #>    scenario name  country_code  year age   sex    education          pop pop_pm #>       <dbl> <fct>        <dbl> <int> <fct> <fct>  <fct>            <dbl>  <dbl> #>  1        2 World          900  1950 0--4  Male   Under 15       172362.  -172. #>  2        2 World          900  1950 0--4  Male   No Education        0      0  #>  3        2 World          900  1950 0--4  Male   Primary             0      0  #>  4        2 World          900  1950 0--4  Male   Secondary           0      0  #>  5        2 World          900  1950 0--4  Male   Post Secondary      0      0  #>  6        2 World          900  1950 0--4  Female Under 15       166026.   166. #>  7        2 World          900  1950 0--4  Female No Education        0      0  #>  8        2 World          900  1950 0--4  Female Primary             0      0  #>  9        2 World          900  1950 0--4  Female Secondary           0      0  #> 10        2 World          900  1950 0--4  Female Post Secondary      0      0  #> # … with 6,500 more rows

title: Overview of the wcde package
text: Use standard ggplot code create population pyramid scale_x_symmetric() lemon package allow equal male female x-axis fill colours set wic_col4 object wcde package contains names colours used Wittgenstein Centre Human Capital Data Explorer Data Explorer. Note wic_col6 wic_col8 objects also exist equivalent plots population data objects corresponding numbers categories education.
code: library(lemon)  w %>%   filter(year == 2020) %>%   ggplot(mapping = aes(x = pop_pm, y = age, fill = fct_rev(education))) +   geom_col() +   geom_vline(xintercept = 0, colour = "black") +   scale_x_symmetric(labels = abs) +   scale_fill_manual(values = wic_col4, name = "Education") +   labs(x = "Population (millions)", y = "Age") +   theme_bw()

title: Overview of the wcde package
text: Add male female labels x-axis Creating facet plot strips bottom transparent backgrounds space . Set x axis zero expansion beyond values data allowing two sides pyramids meet. Add geom_blank() allow equal x-axis additional space end largest columns.
code: w <- w %>%   mutate(pop_max = ifelse(sex == "Male", -max(pop/1e3), max(pop/1e3)))  w %>%   filter(year == 2020) %>%   ggplot(mapping = aes(x = pop_pm, y = age, fill = fct_rev(education))) +   geom_col() +   geom_vline(xintercept = 0, colour = "black") +   scale_x_continuous(labels = abs, expand = c(0, 0)) +   scale_fill_manual(values = wic_col4, name = "Education") +   labs(x = "Population (millions)", y = "Age") +   facet_wrap(facets = "sex", scales = "free_x", strip.position = "bottom") +   geom_blank(mapping = aes(x = pop_max * 1.1)) +   theme(panel.spacing.x = unit(0, "pt"),         strip.placement = "outside",         strip.background = element_rect(fill = "transparent"),         strip.text.x = element_text(margin = margin( b = 0, t = 0)))

title: Overview of the wcde package
text: Animate pyramid past data projection periods using transition_time() function gganimate package
code: library(gganimate)  ggplot(data = w,        mapping = aes(x = pop_pm, y = age, fill = fct_rev(education))) +   geom_col() +   geom_vline(xintercept = 0, colour = "black") +   scale_x_continuous(labels = abs, expand = c(0, 0)) +   scale_fill_manual(values = wic_col4, name = "Education") +   facet_wrap(facets = "sex", scales = "free_x", strip.position = "bottom") +   geom_blank(mapping = aes(x = pop_max * 1.1)) +   theme(panel.spacing.x = unit(0, "pt"),         strip.placement = "outside",         strip.background = element_rect(fill = "transparent"),         strip.text.x = element_text(margin = margin(b = 0, t = 0))) +   transition_time(time = year) +   labs(x = "Population (millions)", y = "Age",        title = 'SSP2 World Population {round(frame_time)}')

title: Authors and Citation
text: Abel GJ (2023). wcde: Download Data Wittgenstein Centre Human Capital Data Explorer. R package version 0.0.6, https://guyabel.github.io/wcde/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {wcde: Download Data from the Wittgenstein Centre Human Capital Data Explorer},   author = {Guy J. Abel},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.6},   url = {https://guyabel.github.io/wcde/}, }

what: Download Data from the Wittgenstein Centre Human Capital Data Explorer
title: Download Data from the Wittgenstein Centre Human Capital Data Explorer
text: Download data Wittgenstein Centre Demography Human Capital Data Explorer R See pkgdown site full details.

title: Download Data from the Wittgenstein Centre Human Capital Data Explorer
text: can install released version wcde CRAN : Install developmental version :
code: install.packages("wcde") library(devtools) install_github("guyabel/wcde", ref = "main")

title: Download Data from the Wittgenstein Centre Human Capital Data Explorer
text: Download data based indicator, scenario country code:
code: library(wcde) #> Suggested citation for data: #> Wittgenstein Centre for Demography and Global Human Capital (WIC) Wittgenstein Centre Data Explorer. Version 2.0, 2018  # SSP2 education specific tfr for Austria get_wcde(indicator = "etfr", country_name = "Austria") #> # A tibble: 102 × 6 #>    scenario name    country_code education          period     etfr #>       <dbl> <chr>          <dbl> <chr>              <chr>     <dbl> #>  1        2 Austria           40 No Education       2015-2020  1.64 #>  2        2 Austria           40 Incomplete Primary 2015-2020  1.64 #>  3        2 Austria           40 Primary            2015-2020  1.64 #>  4        2 Austria           40 Lower Secondary    2015-2020  1.66 #>  5        2 Austria           40 Upper Secondary    2015-2020  1.46 #>  6        2 Austria           40 Post Secondary     2015-2020  1.36 #>  7        2 Austria           40 No Education       2020-2025  1.68 #>  8        2 Austria           40 Incomplete Primary 2020-2025  1.68 #>  9        2 Austria           40 Primary            2020-2025  1.68 #> 10        2 Austria           40 Lower Secondary    2020-2025  1.67 #> # … with 92 more rows  # SSP2 education specific population sizes for Iran and Kenya get_wcde(indicator = "pop", country_code = c(364, 404), pop_edu = "four") #> # A tibble: 310 × 6 #>    scenario name                       country_code  year education         pop #>       <dbl> <fct>                             <dbl> <dbl> <fct>           <dbl> #>  1        2 Iran (Islamic Republic of)          364  1950 Under 15       6210   #>  2        2 Iran (Islamic Republic of)          364  1950 No Education   9648.  #>  3        2 Iran (Islamic Republic of)          364  1950 Primary        1009.  #>  4        2 Iran (Islamic Republic of)          364  1950 Secondary       231.  #>  5        2 Iran (Islamic Republic of)          364  1950 Post Secondary   20.8 #>  6        2 Iran (Islamic Republic of)          364  1955 Under 15       7559.  #>  7        2 Iran (Islamic Republic of)          364  1955 No Education   9983.  #>  8        2 Iran (Islamic Republic of)          364  1955 Primary        1343.  #>  9        2 Iran (Islamic Republic of)          364  1955 Secondary       375.  #> 10        2 Iran (Islamic Republic of)          364  1955 Post Secondary   33.8 #> # … with 300 more rows  # SSP1, 2 and 3 gender gaps in educational attainment (15+) for all countries get_wcde(indicator = "ggapedu15", scenario = 1:3) #> # A tibble: 124,038 × 6 #>    scenario name                     country_code  year education    ggapedu15 #>       <int> <chr>                           <dbl> <dbl> <chr>            <dbl> #>  1        1 Bulgaria                          100  1950 No Education       -16 #>  2        1 Myanmar                           104  1950 No Education       -13 #>  3        1 Burundi                           108  1950 No Education       -11 #>  4        1 Belarus                           112  1950 No Education       -10 #>  5        1 Cambodia                          116  1950 No Education       -28 #>  6        1 Algeria                            12  1950 No Education        -6 #>  7        1 Cameroon                          120  1950 No Education       -16 #>  8        1 Canada                            124  1950 No Education        -1 #>  9        1 Cape Verde                        132  1950 No Education       -14 #> 10        1 Central African Republic          140  1950 No Education        -4 #> # … with 124,028 more rows

title: Education group sums — edu_group_sum
text: Cleans epop data, downloaded using wcde() function, summations population 4, 6 8 education groups.

title: Education group sums — edu_group_sum
code: edu_group_sum(d = NULL, n = 4, strip_totals = TRUE, factor_convert = TRUE)

title: Education group sums — edu_group_sum
text: d Data frame downloaded n Number education groups (4, 6 8) strip_totals Remove total sums epop column. strip education totals year < 2015 n = 8 past data population size 8 education groups unavailable. factor_convert Convert columns character strings factors, levels based order appearance.

title: Education group sums — edu_group_sum
text: tibble data selected.

title: Education group sums — edu_group_sum
text: Strips epop data set relevant rows n education groups.

title: Education group sums — edu_group_sum
code: library(tidyverse) #> ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ── #> ✔ dplyr     1.1.0     ✔ readr     2.1.4 #> ✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.0 #> ✔ ggplot2   3.4.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1 #> ✔ lubridate 1.9.2     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0 #> ✔ purrr     1.0.2      #> ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── #> ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() #> ✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag() #> ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors past_epop %>%   filter(year == 2020) %>%   edu_group_sum() #> # A tibble: 42,210 × 7 #>    name     country_code  year age   sex    education       epop #>    <fct>           <dbl> <dbl> <fct> <fct>  <fct>          <dbl> #>  1 Bulgaria          100  2020 0--4  Male   Under 15        161. #>  2 Bulgaria          100  2020 0--4  Male   No Education      0  #>  3 Bulgaria          100  2020 0--4  Male   Primary           0  #>  4 Bulgaria          100  2020 0--4  Male   Secondary         0  #>  5 Bulgaria          100  2020 0--4  Male   Post Secondary    0  #>  6 Bulgaria          100  2020 0--4  Female Under 15        152. #>  7 Bulgaria          100  2020 0--4  Female No Education      0  #>  8 Bulgaria          100  2020 0--4  Female Primary           0  #>  9 Bulgaria          100  2020 0--4  Female Secondary         0  #> 10 Bulgaria          100  2020 0--4  Female Post Secondary    0  #> # … with 42,200 more rows

what: Select every other (nth) element from a vector — every_other
title: Select every other (nth) element from a vector — every_other
text: Select every (nth) element vector

title: Select every other (nth) element from a vector — every_other
code: every_other(x, n = 2, start = 1, fill = NULL)

title: Select every other (nth) element from a vector — every_other
text: x Vector select (remove) elements n Numeric value number elements skip. Default 2, .e. skips every second element start Numeric value indicate element vector commence . fill Character string used place skipped element. default NULL hence skipped elements removed rather replaced.

title: Select every other (nth) element from a vector — every_other
text: Vector elements removed

title: Select every other (nth) element from a vector — every_other
code: every_other(x = letters) #>  [1] "a" "c" "e" "g" "i" "k" "m" "o" "q" "s" "u" "w" "y" every_other(LETTERS, n = 3, start = 6) #> [1] "F" "I" "L" "O" "R" "U" "X" every_other(x = letters, fill = "") #>  [1] "a" ""  "c" ""  "e" ""  "g" ""  "i" ""  "k" ""  "m" ""  "o" ""  "q" ""  "s" #> [20] ""  "u" ""  "w" ""  "y" ""

title: Find available indicator code names in the Wittgenstein Centre Human Capital Data Explorer — find_indicator
code: find_indicator("education") #> # A tibble: 9 × 3 #>   indicator description                                      definition          #>   <chr>     <chr>                                            <chr>               #> 1 bpop      Population Size by Broad Age (000's)             "De facto populati… #> 2 epop      Population Size by Education (000's)             "De facto populati… #> 3 prop      Educational Attainment Distribution              "De facto populati… #> 4 bprop     Educational Attainment Distribution by Broad Age "De facto populati… #> 5 ggapedu15 Gender Gap in Educational Attainment (15+)       "The difference be… #> 6 ggapedu25 Gender Gap in Educational Attainment (25+)       "The difference be… #> 7 etfr      Total Fertility Rate by Education                "The average numbe… #> 8 eassr     Age-Specific Survival Ratio by Education         "Survivorship of p… #> 9 easfr     Age-Specific Fertility Rate by Education         "Number of births … find_indicator("migr") #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   indicator description   definition                                             #>   <chr>     <chr>         <chr>                                                  #> 1 net       Net Migration "The number of immigrants minus the number of emigran… find_indicator("fert") #> # A tibble: 4 × 3 #>   indicator description                              definition                  #>   <chr>     <chr>                                    <chr>                       #> 1 tfr       Total Fertility Rate                     "The average number of chi… #> 2 etfr      Total Fertility Rate by Education        "The average number of chi… #> 3 asfr      Age-Specific Fertility Rate              "Number of births occurrin… #> 4 easfr     Age-Specific Fertility Rate by Education "Number of births occurrin…

what: Download data from the Wittgenstein Centre Human Capital Data Explorer — get_wcde
title: Download data from the Wittgenstein Centre Human Capital Data Explorer — get_wcde
text: Downloads data Wittgenstein Centre Human Capital Data Explorer. Requires working internet connection.

title: Download data from the Wittgenstein Centre Human Capital Data Explorer — get_wcde
code: get_wcde(   indicator = "pop",   scenario = 2,   country_code = NULL,   country_name = NULL,   pop_age = c("total", "all"),   pop_sex = c("total", "both", "all"),   pop_edu = c("total", "four", "six", "eight"),   include_scenario_names = FALSE,   server = c("iiasa", "github", "1&1", "search-available", "iiasa-local"),   version = c("wcde-v3", "wcde-v2", "wcde-v1") )

title: Download data from the Wittgenstein Centre Human Capital Data Explorer — get_wcde
text: indicator One character string based indicator column wic_indicators data frame, representing variable downloaded. scenario Vector length one numbers corresponding scenarios. See details information. Defaults 2 SSP2 Medium scenario. country_code Vector length one country numeric codes based ISO 3 digit numeric values. country_name Vector length one country names. corresponding country code guessed using countrycodes package. pop_age Character string population age groups indicator set pop. Defaults age groups total, can set . pop_sex Character string population sexes indicatoris set pop. Defaults sex total, can set . pop_edu Character string population educational attainment indicator set pop. Defaults total, can set four, six eight. include_scenario_names Logical vector length one indicate include additional columns scenario names short names. FALSE default. server Character string server download . Defaults iiasa, can use github 1&1 IIASA server . Can check availability setting search-available version Character string version projections obtain. Defaults wcde-v3, can use wcde-v2 wcde-v1. Scenario indicator availability vary versions.

title: Download data from the Wittgenstein Centre Human Capital Data Explorer — get_wcde
text: tibble data selected.

title: Download data from the Wittgenstein Centre Human Capital Data Explorer — get_wcde
text: country_name country_code provided data countries regions downloaded. full list available countries regions can found wic_locations data frame. indicator must set value first column table available demographic indicators: See wic_indicators data frame details. scenario must set one values first column table available future scenarios: See wic_scenarios data frame details.

title: Download data from the Wittgenstein Centre Human Capital Data Explorer — get_wcde
code: # \donttest{ # SSP2 tfr for Austria and Bulgaria get_wcde(indicator = "tfr", country_code = c(40, 100)) #> Version wcde-v3 not available on server, using wcde-v2 #> # A tibble: 60 × 5 #>    scenario name     country_code period      tfr #>       <dbl> <chr>           <dbl> <chr>     <dbl> #>  1        2 Austria            40 1950-1955  2.1  #>  2        2 Bulgaria          100 1950-1955  2.53 #>  3        2 Austria            40 1955-1960  2.57 #>  4        2 Bulgaria          100 1955-1960  2.3  #>  5        2 Austria            40 1960-1965  2.78 #>  6        2 Bulgaria          100 1960-1965  2.22 #>  7        2 Austria            40 1965-1970  2.57 #>  8        2 Bulgaria          100 1965-1970  2.13 #>  9        2 Austria            40 1970-1975  2.04 #> 10        2 Bulgaria          100 1970-1975  2.16 #> # … with 50 more rows  # SSP1 and SSP2 life expectancy for Vietnam and United Kingdom (guessing the country codes) get_wcde(scenario = c(1, 2), indicator = "e0", country_name = c("Vietnam", "UK")) #> Version wcde-v3 not available on server, using wcde-v2 #> # A tibble: 240 × 6 #>    scenario name                                      count…¹ sex   period    e0 #>       <dbl> <chr>                                       <dbl> <chr> <chr>  <dbl> #>  1        1 Viet Nam                                      704 Male  1950-…  50.8 #>  2        1 United Kingdom of Great Britain and Nort…     826 Male  1950-…  66.8 #>  3        1 Viet Nam                                      704 Fema… 1950-…  56.5 #>  4        1 United Kingdom of Great Britain and Nort…     826 Fema… 1950-…  71.9 #>  5        1 Viet Nam                                      704 Male  1955-…  54   #>  6        1 United Kingdom of Great Britain and Nort…     826 Male  1955-…  67.7 #>  7        1 Viet Nam                                      704 Fema… 1955-…  60.7 #>  8        1 United Kingdom of Great Britain and Nort…     826 Fema… 1955-…  73.4 #>  9        1 Viet Nam                                      704 Male  1960-…  56.8 #> 10        1 United Kingdom of Great Britain and Nort…     826 Male  1960-…  68   #> # … with 230 more rows, and abbreviated variable name ¹​country_code  # SSP1 and SSP3 population by education for all countries get_wcde(scenario = c(1, 3), indicator = "tfr") #> Version wcde-v3 not available on server, using wcde-v2 #> # A tibble: 13,740 × 5 #>    scenario name                     country_code period      tfr #>       <dbl> <chr>                           <dbl> <chr>     <dbl> #>  1        1 Bulgaria                          100 1950-1955  2.53 #>  2        1 Myanmar                           104 1950-1955  6    #>  3        1 Burundi                           108 1950-1955  6.8  #>  4        1 Belarus                           112 1950-1955  2.61 #>  5        1 Cambodia                          116 1950-1955  6.95 #>  6        1 Algeria                            12 1950-1955  7.28 #>  7        1 Cameroon                          120 1950-1955  5.49 #>  8        1 Canada                            124 1950-1955  3.64 #>  9        1 Cape Verde                        132 1950-1955  6.57 #> 10        1 Central African Republic          140 1950-1955  5.52 #> # … with 13,730 more rows  # population totals (aggregated over age, sex and education) get_wcde(indicator = "pop", country_name = "Austria") #> Version wcde-v3 not available on server, using wcde-v2 #> # A tibble: 31 × 5 #>    scenario name    country_code  year   pop #>       <dbl> <chr>          <dbl> <int> <dbl> #>  1        2 Austria           40  1950 6936. #>  2        2 Austria           40  1955 6951. #>  3        2 Austria           40  1960 7068. #>  4        2 Austria           40  1965 7302. #>  5        2 Austria           40  1970 7512. #>  6        2 Austria           40  1975 7630. #>  7        2 Austria           40  1980 7599. #>  8        2 Austria           40  1985 7603. #>  9        2 Austria           40  1990 7709. #> 10        2 Austria           40  1995 7975. #> # … with 21 more rows  # population totals by education group get_wcde(indicator = "pop", country_name = "Austria", pop_edu = "four") #> Version wcde-v3 not available on server, using wcde-v2 #> # A tibble: 155 × 6 #>    scenario name    country_code  year education        pop #>       <dbl> <fct>          <dbl> <int> <fct>          <dbl> #>  1        2 Austria           40  1950 Under 15       1579. #>  2        2 Austria           40  1950 No Education      0  #>  3        2 Austria           40  1950 Primary        3027. #>  4        2 Austria           40  1950 Secondary      2129. #>  5        2 Austria           40  1950 Post Secondary  201  #>  6        2 Austria           40  1955 Under 15       1556. #>  7        2 Austria           40  1955 No Education      0  #>  8        2 Austria           40  1955 Primary        2882. #>  9        2 Austria           40  1955 Secondary      2292. #> 10        2 Austria           40  1955 Post Secondary  220. #> # … with 145 more rows  # population totals by age-sex group get_wcde(indicator = "pop", country_name = "Austria", pop_age = "all", pop_sex = "both") #> Version wcde-v3 not available on server, using wcde-v2 #> # A tibble: 1,302 × 7 #>    scenario name    country_code age    sex    year   pop #>       <dbl> <chr>          <dbl> <chr>  <chr> <int> <dbl> #>  1        2 Austria           40 0--4   Male   1950  264. #>  2        2 Austria           40 5--9   Male   1950  285. #>  3        2 Austria           40 10--14 Male   1950  255. #>  4        2 Austria           40 15--19 Male   1950  233. #>  5        2 Austria           40 20--24 Male   1950  242. #>  6        2 Austria           40 25--29 Male   1950  223. #>  7        2 Austria           40 30--34 Male   1950  151. #>  8        2 Austria           40 35--39 Male   1950  220. #>  9        2 Austria           40 40--44 Male   1950  246  #> 10        2 Austria           40 45--49 Male   1950  255. #> # … with 1,292 more rows # }

what: Pull multiple vectors for a given indicator, scenarios and .Rdata file names — get_wcde_single
title: Pull multiple vectors for a given indicator, scenarios and .Rdata file names — get_wcde_single
text: Requires working internet connection. Intended internal use.

title: Pull multiple vectors for a given indicator, scenarios and .Rdata file names — get_wcde_single
code: get_wcde_single(   indicator = NULL,   scenario = 2,   country_code = NULL,   server = NULL,   version = NULL )

title: Pull multiple vectors for a given indicator, scenarios and .Rdata file names — get_wcde_single
text: indicator One character string based name column wic_indicators data frame, representing variable interested. scenario Vector numbers corresponding scenarios. See details wcde information. country_code Vector length one country numeric codes based ISO 3 digit numeric values. server Character string server download . Defaults iiasa, can use github IIASA server . version Character string version projections obtain. Defaults wcde-v2, can use wcde-v2 fume. Scenario indicator availability vary versions.

title: Pull multiple vectors for a given indicator, scenarios and .Rdata file names — get_wcde_single
text: tibble multiple columns.

title: wcde 0.0.3
text: CRAN release: 2021-10-30 Add authors vignette Add start-citation note Renamed wcde_pull() get_wcde_single() Initial pkgdown working Github actions working Website description Allow edu_group_sum() work without scenario column

title: wcde 0.0.5

title: wcde 0.0.6
text: Add server argument get_wcde() Updated UK pop-age file scenario 1 server Replaced dplyr::summarize() dplyr::reframe() get_wcde_single() Add version argument get_wcde() Changed files servers .rds code get_wcde() retrieve .rds data
